content.description:
Begin at the small corner next to the boulder and follow the bolts. Great climbing through technical series of overlaps. According to Howie Richardson, the name comes from the "plague of Barleys" that claimed the FA.

Starts in a small corner close to a big boulder at the far left end of the wall.
Mixed - 6 bolts some gear.

climbs.name: Plum Line
climbs.fa: Howie Richardson, Dan van der Torre 1989  Direct start: Howie Richardson, Hugh Lenney 1993

content.description: Starts on the ledge. Sustained 5.9 climbing with a slight bulge at top (could be considered the crux). Starts at the leftmost rap station on top of the ledge, to the right of Stouthearted. 10 bolts, but some take a 1" CD for a slightly run-out section. **NOTE: This route is 35m if you don't rap or downclimb from the ledge.**

climbs.name: Sagging Bumline
climbs.fa: Robin Barley, James Hote, Nicole Morath 2000

content.description: can be a bit hard to read if your new to the area with the same bulge as Plum Line up top (right side of the bulge doesnt share any moves) Starts at the rightmost rap station on the ledge, just right of Plum Line. Shares the first 3 bolts of Dumb Line, which then breaks off right. 8 bolts. Like for Plum Line, it could be useful to take a 1" CD for there is a slight run-out. **NOTE: This route is 35m if you don't rap or downclimb from the ledge.**

The other gem at this wall, it climbs immediately left of Plum Line (and shares the initial start to the ledge). Fun, thoughtful climbing leads to a somewhat distinct crux, followed by a good romp to the top. Starts just left of the left hand rap station on the ledge. 11 bolts. ***NOTE: This route is 35m if you don't feel comfortable downclimbing from the ledge.**

Climb the slabby boulder to the handrail (need a big cam). After you pull over, follow the poorly protected groove (easy, but don't fall here). After your last placement in the groove (20mm CD), go left and finish on 4 bolts.

Left side of the wall at a large slabby boulder.
Mixed - 4 bolts and a variety of cams.

Trends left from the ledges then up some flakes in a shallow scoop. Step right and then left past the bulge.

Starts at the very left side of the flake/ledge that houses the start of Stouthearted, Plum Line, etc.
Gear + 2 bolts.
A very popular area with a couple of the best 5.9/5.10a routes in Skaha.
